Modular math functions

A common reason to use a large-integer library is to implement public-key encryption, and the algorithms for such encryption often use modular math.

template<size_t Bits>
fixed_integer< Bits > boost::xint::invmod (const fixed_integer< Bits > &n, const fixed_integer< Bits > &m)
template<size_t Bits>
fixed_integer< Bits > boost::xint::mod (const fixed_integer< Bits > &n, const fixed_integer< Bits > &modBy)
template<size_t Bits>
fixed_integer< Bits > boost::xint::mulmod (const fixed_integer< Bits > &n, const fixed_integer< Bits > &by, const fixed_integer< Bits > &m)
template<size_t Bits>
fixed_integer< Bits > boost::xint::powmod (const fixed_integer< Bits > &n, const fixed_integer< Bits > &e, const fixed_integer< Bits > &m, bool noMontgomery)
template<size_t Bits>
fixed_integer< Bits > boost::xint::sqrmod (const fixed_integer< Bits > &n, const fixed_integer< Bits > &m)

Operators

These act exactly the same as for the built-in integer types.



#define BOOST_XINT_FIXED_BINARY_FN(name, body)
#define BOOST_XINT_NFIXED
bool boost::xint::operator!= (const fixed_integer_any &num1, const fixed_integer_any &num2)
bool boost::xint::operator< (const fixed_integer_any &num1, const fixed_integer_any &num2)

bool boost::xint::operator== (const fixed_integer_any &num1, const fixed_integer_any &num2)
bool boost::xint::operator> (const fixed_integer_any &num1, const fixed_integer_any &num2)
bool boost::xint::operator>= (const fixed_integer_any &num1, const fixed_integer_any &num2)

Detailed Description

Declares the fixed-size integer type.

Definition in file fixed_integer.hpp.

Define Documentation

#define BOOST_XINT_FIXED_BINARY_FN ( name,
body   ) 
Value:
template <size_t Bits> \
fixed_integer<Bits> name(const fixed_integer<Bits>& op1, \
    const fixed_integer<Bits>& op2) \
{ \
    fixed_integer<Bits> r; \
    body(r, op1, op2); \
    return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(r); \
} \
\
template <size_t Bits, typename T> \
BOOST_XINT_NFIXED name(const fixed_integer<Bits>& n1, const T& n2) { \
    fixed_integer<Bits> r; \
    body(r, n1, fixed_integer_any(n2)); \
    return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(r); \
} \
\
template <typename T, size_t Bits> \
BOOST_XINT_NFIXED name(const T& n1, const fixed_integer<Bits>& n2) { \
    fixed_integer<Bits> r; \
    body(r, fixed_integer_any(n1), n2); \
    return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(r); \
}

#define BOOST_XINT_FIXED_OPEQ_FN ( name,
body   ) 
Value:
template <size_t Bits> \
fixed_integer<Bits>& fixed_integer<Bits>::name(const fixed_integer_any& n) { \
    body(*this, *this, n); \
    return *this; \
}
